quoteFirst: (_Bugle and whistle. Off for afternoon drill.--Now at
quoteLast: after learning to pitch shelter tents_)
title: At Plattsburg
author: French, Allen, 1870-1946

quoteFirst: Either he could hoist the gig on the port quarter in full view of the enemy, or he could tow her alongside to starboard, and risk her being seen. He chose the latter, and at
quoteLast: proceeded on a south-westerly course at slow speed. The submarine now came up right astern, so course had to be altered gradually to keep the German on the port quarter and out of sight of the gig.
title: Q-Ships and Their Story
author: Chatterton, E. Keble (Edward Keble), 1878-1944

quoteFirst: The middle watch of Friday the 10th had easterly airs that gave her an average of three knots, and much lightning. At 9.50 a.m. started motor and ran it until 0.50 p.m.; and again from
title: The mystery of Easter island: the story of an expedition
author: Routledge, Katherine, 1866-1935
